snippet: Some residents of Bloomingburg object to a townhouse development, which they say will bring a large concentration of Hasidim and will change the atmosphere of their quiet village.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation raid on 20 properties owned by developer Shalom Lamm in village of Bloomingburg, NY, adds twist to controversy over his townhouse development project in the village; some residents, worried that project would bring a large concentration of Hasidim to village, changing its character, had filed claims of voter fraud against Lamm, accusing him of ensuring village board majority that would be sympathetic to his project.
lead_paragraph: Some residents of Bloomingburg object to a townhouse development, which they say will bring a large concentration of Hasidim and will change the atmosphere of their quiet village.

headline.main: A Quiet Village in the Catskills Braces for an Influx of Hasidim
headline.print_headline: Quiet Village Braces for Influx of Hasidim
